pages.text: Grading Sleeves are not for the casual Buddycard collector. You have been warned. $(br2)Grading Sleeves allow you to grade cards by holding it in your offhand with an ungraded card in your main hand. It will get 1 of 5 grades.
Grading sleeves are relatively cheap, but can also be found naturally in villages, bastions, end cities, shipwrecks, and buried treasures.

pages.title: Grade D
pages.text: Grade D is the most common grade to get when you grade a card. $(br2)These cards are below average quality, and extremely common. Roughly 2/5 cards are grade D.

pages.title: Grade C
pages.text: Grade C is the second most common grade to get when you grade a card. $(br2)These cards are average quality, and are quite common. Roughly 8/25 cards are grade C.

pages.title: Grade B
pages.text: Grade B is one of the more obtainable high quality card grades. $(br2)These cards are above average quality, but not too hard to find. Roughly 9/50 cards are grade B.

pages.title: Grade A
pages.text: Grade A is a reasonable high quality card to be proud of. $(br2)These cards are almost perfect in quality, and quite hard to find. Roughly 1/10 cards are grade A.

pages.title: Grade S
pages.text: Grade S is the most valuable card grade you can find. Getting one is something to be proud of, and compared to other cards they are priceless. $(br2)These cards are mint condition, perfect quality, and nearly impossible to find with 1/500 cards being this perfect.
